title: Autonomous Vehicles and Reinforcement Learning
summary: Tesla and Waymo use reinforcement learning alongside supervised learning to train autonomous vehicles — illustrating the limits and possibilities of current AI.
content:
Case Study: Autonomous Vehicle AI

Self-driving cars represent one of the most ambitious AI engineering challenges. Tesla's Autopilot system processes data from cameras, radar, and ultrasonic sensors to make real-time driving decisions.

The AI Stack

Autonomous vehicles combine multiple AI techniques: CNNs for object recognition, SLAM (Simultaneous Localisation and Mapping) for spatial awareness, and reinforcement learning for decision-making in complex traffic scenarios. Tesla uses a "shadow mode" where human drivers make decisions while the AI trains in parallel.

Current Limitations

Despite billions in investment, Level 5 (fully autonomous) vehicles remain elusive. Edge cases — unusual road markings, construction zones, unexpected pedestrian behaviour — remain challenging. The safety implications mean extensive regulatory oversight.

Key Learning

Real-world AI deployment requires understanding both capabilities and limitations. Responsible AI deployment in safety-critical domains demands extreme care, interpretability, and extensive testing.
